resources.string: Unfortunately, Google has removed the ability in KitKat (4.4) for non-system applications to access battery statistics. This companion app restores this function by running as a privileged system application. Root access to your device is required.
Congratulations! This app is correctly installed with access to BATTERY_STATS. No further action is needed. Your companion battery monitor should now be fully functional.
This app needs to be installed in /system/priv-app/. You can do this manually using a tool such as Root Explorer, or use the automated method below.
A reboot is required. Would you like to reboot now?
Copying to /system/priv-app...\n\nMake sure you accept any superuser requests.
Uninstalling app...\n\nMake sure you accept any superuser requests.
Your current SuperUser APK may need updating. You may also try installing BusyBox and trying again, or manually copying the app into /system/priv-app/.

This will remove the app from your launcher. You can launch the app by opening up GSam Battery Monitor and choosing the \'Launch Root Companion\' menu option, or by opening it from the store.\n\nDo you want to continue?
Allows an application to read the current low-level battery use data. May allow the application to find out detailed information about which apps you use.
